net.beaconcontroller.core.internal

Class SpringFrameworkListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.beaconcontroller.core.internal.SpringFrameworkListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventListener, org.springframework.osgi.context.BundleContextAware, org.springframework.osgi.context.event.OsgiBundleApplicationContextListener<org.springframework.osgi.context.event.OsgiBundleApplicationContextEvent>

    public class SpringFrameworkListener
extends Object
implements org.springframework.osgi.context.event.OsgiBundleApplicationContextListener<org.springframework.osgi.context.event.OsgiBundleApplicationContextEvent>, org.springframework.osgi.context.BundleContextAware
    This class listens for all known Spring contexts to fully complete loading then alerts the Controller class that this has occurred, and starts the listening socket allowing switches to connect.
    Author:
    David Erickson (daviderickson@cs.stanford.edu)

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void checkPublishedServices()
      Checks for a published ApplicationContext in the OSGi service registry for every Bundle containing a Spring context that has not been detected as having been started.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()

      • checkPublishedServices

        protected void checkPublishedServices()
        Checks for a published ApplicationContext in the OSGi service registry for every Bundle containing a Spring context that has not been detected as having been started.

      • triggerStarted

        protected void triggerStarted()
        This method is called once all Bundles containing Spring application context metadata have been detected as started. It calls the Controller class to alert it to start accepting switch connections.

      • setBundleContext

        public void setBundleContext(org.osgi.framework.BundleContext context)
